tool.name: Call peaks
tool.command:
#import os #import tempfile #set $tmp_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp() #macs makes very messy output, need to contain it into a temp dir, then provide to user
##TODO #request for a temp_dir variable
macs2 bdgpeakcall --ifile $infile --cutoff $cutoff --min-length $minlen --max-gap $maxgap $callsummits $notrackline

param.name: cutoff
param.label: Cutoff for peaks
param.help: Cutoff depends on which method you used for score track. If the file contains pvalue scores from MACS2, score 5 means pvalue 1e-5. DEFAULT: 5.0 (--cutoff)

param.name: minlen
param.label: Minimum length of peak
param.help: better to set it as d value (--min-length)

param.name: maxgap
param.label: Maximum gap between significant points in a peak
param.help: better to set it as tag size DEFAULT: 30 (--max-gap)

param.name: callsummits
param.label: If set, MACS will use a more sophisticated approach to find all summits in each enriched peak region.

tool.help:
